fields.description:
While trying to manage the deployment keys of a repo in our team namespace, my co-worker could'nt edit the deployment key, since the edit option was not present.\\
Although we both have Administrator access, i could see an 'Edit' link and he didn't. We found out, that this was caused by the different languages that we used.

English -> Edit available

German -> Edit *not* available

What bugs me, is that not even a fallback to the english word was made. Instead the edit option was simply not there.
fields.summary: Missing 'Edit' link/button on the deployment keys page (BB-10817)

fields.description: When loading list of issues using rest API, number of votes is not included in the response json object. Also API for voting is missing.
fields.summary: Include votes to issues API (BB-10819)

fields.description: Using the API (https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories) to create a repository one can specify mutually exclusive names and slugs. Updating any repository detail resubmits the name provide and updates the slug. Thus returning later to modify any value on the repository details page (eg website or description) changes the slug and thus all of the team members and servers need to update their remotes.
fields.summary: Renaming API created repositories (BB-10818)

fields.description:
Hello,

In my team, I added several user groups with NO access to team repositories. I overwrite it per repository by giving READ access to specific user groups. A user from one of these user groups can then fork the private repository (except if I didn't allow it from the repository details page).\\
The fork is private like I specified it in the repository details page. Nevertheless, the user can manage access to his/her fork and give access (by mistake) to any group of the team in which he/she is and thus give access to someone who doesn't have access to the main repository. Even worse, he/she can give access (by mistake) to anyone who is not a member of the team.

It's not good at all since he/she will be able to see all the old commits and files of the main repository which are present in the fork.

Please, the owner of a fork of a private repository MUST NOT manage access to his/her fork. Otherwise, I wil have to disable forking for the members of my team and I will have to create forks for them with the team as owner. It doesn't sound like the way to do it.
fields.summary: Fork access management to ANYONE

fields.description:
Hi there, I created the account with username MarkDrew-Zapier and as soon as I had done that I got an account has been disactivated, contact support, thus I am here, contacting support

Any help appreciated.
fields.summary: Account disactivated on login

fields.description:
*Given* Author upload a pull request containing 1 or more commits

*And* Reviewer do code review process

*When* Reviewer mark all commits in pull request as 'Approved' (using Approve button)

*Then* given pull request should be automatically approved on behalf of Reviewer
fields.summary: Automatically mark pull request as 'Approved' when all commits in that pull request got approval.

fields.description:
I just signed up for a new account. However, upon responding to the confirmation email, a message appears that says, "We were unable to confirm your email address. The validation email may have expired."

A quick search suggested this:\\
You should be about to go back to your list of email addresses (Account > Email addresses) and click 'resend confirmation' for the email address in question.

However, when I go to Email Addresses, there is no "Resend Confirmation" link. What should I do?
fields.summary: Problem confirming my email

fields.description: No need to show 'send pull request' checkbox in commit window if I am going to do a commit via web editor in my own repo
fields.summary: Hide 'send pull request' checkbox in commit window
Problem creating a pull request
UI Proposal to reduce +1 comments

fields.description: I was trying to fork of jessicarcl/instagramTrial to jessicarcl/instagramWidget. It is now stuck on the "Cloning Repository" screen.
fields.summary: Stuck cloning repository

fields.description:
When I merged this PR via the web ui:\\
https://bitbucket.org/grabone/goinventory/pull-request/150/move-stockoffer-stockrecord-to-new-stocks/diff\\
I got an error dialogue, something about the merge having failed.

But reloading the page the merge has happened (the PR says there's nothing to merge), but the PR isn't marked as merged.
fields.summary: Pull request failing during merge (merge happened but I got an error message)

fields.description:
When we import a project from Github, there should be a Sync feature, just like when we fork a Bitbucket project.

I know there is already another Issue/Proposal that was made to add the creation of Pull Requests to Github repos; so these two features could go along.
fields.summary: Sync feature on external Git Repos

fields.description:
Hi,

afaik at the moment you can only have one README file, where yourself decide the spoken language (English, German, Dutch, French, etc.).

For my project I use the readme as a simple manual. But the mother tongue of most of my users are not English speaking. To lower the burden for users I would like to have a additional readme in German.

Can you implement something that automatically detects other readme files with have a ISO language code in it (like readme_de.md). So that German users automatically see that readme and not the English one.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Add possibility for README in different spoken languages. (BB-10810)

fields.description: The new design makes difficult to know which dvcs tool is necessary in order to clone a repository (see annotated screenshot).
fields.summary: unclear if a repository is hg or git (BB-10811)

fields.description: When a Bitbucket repo has a large number of commits, in order to go back the the early commits the user must repeatedly click on a previous button (which is very tedious). In the past the site had a page number "breadcrumb" page numbering system. Could this be re-instated?
fields.summary: Commit "breadcrumb" page number feature (BB-10813)

fields.description:
I've been dealing with this problem for a long long long long time.

Can someone please help fix this? Seems to be specific to my repo!

https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/6618/issue-does-not-close-auto-with-the-correct

See the last comment.

https://bitbucket.org/glasslab/aurum/issues?status=new&status=open

I've just commited another 49 commits and none of them can close my issues!

Thanks.
fields.summary: Issue does not close auto with the correct commit message again

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

# Navigate to the downloads tab on your repository
# Upload a file, for example Foo.txt
# Upload the file again

Expected result

* A single file named Foo.txt to be listed
* Calling HTTP GET .../downloads/Foo.txt will return 200 OK with the file contents (for the last file)

Actual result

* Two files named Foo.txt are listed
* Calling HTTP GET .../downloads/Foo.txt results in 500 Internal Server Error

When I tried to "fix" it by deleting one of the files, I got 404 Not Found when trying to download the other file.\\
I had to delete both files and upload one of them again in order to fix it.

If uploading a file with same name as an existing used to overwrite the existing file (so this is a regression error).
fields.summary: Adding duplicate files on Downloads tab causes 500 Server Error and file to be unavailable (BB-10838)

fields.description: The message on the fork, which was offering to synchronize it with source repository when the fork is behind, does not appear anymore. The only way to do it now is using "compare" function, but it is only possible branch by branch.
fields.summary: Fork auto-synchronization does not work any more

fields.description:
The [Bitbucket Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET] is hosted via HTTPS, but it seems that some content is loaded over HTTP.  The result is that various browsers display a warning icon or other indication that the website is not secure.  A brief look at what is being loaded over HTTP shows an HTTP request to ace.atlassian.com, but I didn't look thoroughly; there may be others.

In Google Chrome, the secure icon in the address bar has a warning overlay badge and a detail message saying, "Your connection to confluence.atlassian.com is encrypted with 128-bit encryption. However, this page includes other resources which are not secure. These resources can be viewed by others while in transit, and can be modified by an attacker to change the look of the page."

In Safari, no secure connection icon and company name is shown in the address bar.

In Firefox, no secure connection icon is shown in the address bar; instead it shows a warning icon and a detail message saying, "This website does not supply identity information.  The connection to this website is not fully secure because it contains unencrypted elements (such as images)."
fields.summary: Documentation website is HTTPS but loads some content over HTTP

fields.description:
Hi,

I accidentally created a branch using a URL as the name.  After the branch is created, I can't access or delete it.

Here's the test page with error branch https//abc.com:\\
https://bitbucket.org/keyo321/testbranchnameerror/branches?status=merged

Here's the direct link to the branch:\\
https://bitbucket.org/keyo321/testbranchnameerror/branch/https//abc.com (404)

Attempting to delete the branch throws an error as well.

Any idea how I can remove this branch?

thanks
fields.summary: Can't access or delete a branch named with https.

fields.description:
For code review, and general technical discussions, we are loving and using alot the ability to comment on code on the bitbucket site for each commit..

However if the commit it large, its hard because you have to page through many pages to see if there is any discussion, or chat. it would be nice to at the top have a list of such comments , and be able to click to go directly to it in the page..

Also in a busy system, it would be nice to search, and filter by commits that have these discussions..

plus for an individual file it would be nice to see all discussions regarding that file over its history, and not just this particular commit (a bit like some BLAME stuff)
fields.summary: List of conversations (with in page link) in a commit detail (BB-10790)

I don't see this problem on a project's "Recent activity" or "Commits" areas (among others), for example. I attached a picture of what I see when I hover one on the Dashboard.
fields.summary: Dashboard Activity Date Hover (BB-10789)

fields.description:
Using a private repo, I am having issues with a remote clone. After cloning, I receive a 500 internal server error on specific files (the same ones every time) when accessing them via webserver (repo is a web project). This also occurred when I did a git pull on the remote clone.

I used to simply copy the contents, delete the file, recreate via ftp gui, and paste the contents back in, and the error would disappear, but now it seems to be here permanently.
fields.summary: Internal server error when accessing cloned rep

fields.summary: Not loading images or scripts

fields.description:
Would Bitbucket consider adding Steam as an OAuth provider?

Let me know what you think.

Matt
fields.summary: Add Steam OAuth Support (BB-10788)

fields.description:
In the German version of the source code view there's a button labeled "beschuldigen", which sounds quite funny for a native speaker:\\
In German this means "accuse", while I believe you meant to say "annotate".\\
The literal translation of annotate would be "anmerken", but in German you better use the noun "Anmerkungen" instead.

Another alternative would be "kommentieren" (comment), but that would shift the meaning a bit.
fields.summary: German translation bug

fields.description:
Consider the following scenario:

# You type some text.
# After typing you watch preview and realize that it is not what you want.
# Now you push (?) button to get help.

If you push (?) with left mouse button then it redirects you to the [“Mark up coments” page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Mark%2Bup%2Bcomments%3Bjsessionid%3D25B892469FA32231E1D33EE3C948D550.node3], effectively wasting what you have already typed. Something may be restored by firefox when you press “Back”, but this is not the case if you are typing in “Close issue” or similar popup windows.

Well, now you are educated and push (?) with middle mouse button to open it in new window. _It does not work:_ you see the same page you were seeing before, except for it being 1) in new tab and 2) blank. Text from previous tab did not disappear, but I wanted help and not a blank clone of existing tab.

// Help page on its own is pretty useless though (what you actually want is only accessible through one of the links on it), but that is another issue.
fields.summary: Cicking comment help button loses any entered text (BB-10794)

fields.description:
Ok, I understand Opera's Presto isn't supported anymore, but it's still a good browser.\\
The issue is very simple.\\
On the right top corner of repository overview page you have Page Controls.\\
At the Opera 12 browser you see Share link is aligned to the baseline while all controls are aligned to the top.

Actually the reason and solution is clear.\\
You have *#repo-share-link* have which have *vertical-align: baseline;* from *.aui-button* class. Meanwhile for other controls top align is specified or inherited from parent *.aui-group > .aui-item* class.\\
So the solution is to add *vertical-align: top;* to the *#repo-share-link* selector.
fields.summary: Share button misaligned on overview page in Opera (BB-10793)

fields.summary: my account has been deactivated.

fields.description:
I have recently migrated some projects from a locally hosted SVN server to BitBucket.

The push seemed to happen successfully.

When checking them out on other people's dev machines, they consistently stall at 65% and 10% respectively.

For example (usernames and repository names changes)

[

{code}

xyz@localhost projects]$ git clone git@bitbucket.org:deliverycube/repo.git repo
Initialized empty Git repository in /home/xyz/development/projects/repo/.git/

Write failed: Broken pipe1240/11758), 5.40 MiB | 1 KiB/s   
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
fatal: early EOF
fatal: index-pack failed
{code}

Another one fails consistently at 65%.

I don't think it is an ssh problem.

The repositories are not particularly big.

They stall at the same point on different machines.

fields.description:
If you configured '*Pull Request POST*' as per following post hooks continue on being sent:

[ ] Approve / Unapprove

[ ] Comments

[ ] Create / Edit / Merge / Decline

_All checkboxes unchecked_

Would be possible to create a notification informing that at least one option needs to selected, otherwise, the same should be deleted. Otherwise, prevent post hooks from being sent if non is selected.
fields.summary: Pull request POST hook, triggers even if nothing is checked.

fields.description:
I am a fairly new Bitbucket user.

I would like to know if there is a way to send email notifications to reviewers of pull requests when the review is not done within a configurable amount of time.

Today I encountered a pull request that had not been reviewed by all reviewers, and it had been two weeks. This is the situation I would like to handle with email notifications.

Regards,

Francis Lee Spafford\\
Red Lion Controls | www.redlion.net
fields.summary: Remind reviewers of Bitbucket pull requests? (BB-10782)

fields.description:
My page http://subudeepak.bitbucket.org/ASD/presentation.html is downloading instead of being displayed and I figured out that this is because the content-disposition is being set to attachment for this page by the server. Please help me out.

Thanks
fields.summary: content-disposition

fields.description:
Bitbucket unfortunately has a number of uneducated and inconsiderate users who like to spam the rest of us by commenting on issues with things like "+1" rather than using the proper voting function. These comments add no value and everyone watching the issue gets an email (quite often hundreds of people).

Please prevent users commenting with just "+1" -- requiring at least 10 characters would be one solution (as per e.g. StackOverflow).

Even better - suspend user accounts for 24 hours that try; that should put a stop to it promptly.

This will help make Bitbucket a better service for its dedicated users.
fields.summary: Prevent Users Commenting Just "+1"

fields.description: I want to use hex format BCLOUD-20A0FF as a reference to colors (or anything else actually) in issue comments or wiki on Bitbucket, but the system replaces it with a link to an issue if the issue with such a number exists. It doesn't work in many cases, so we need at least some way to escape this if we don't want/need to get it replaced with links to issues/commits. I haven't found any means to work around that, so please either let us know how it can be done, or implement sort of escaping to not get links where we don't need them.
fields.summary: Can't escape number sign (hash character) to avoid links to issues when unneeded (BB-10780)

fields.description: We should be able to type custom versions, not just the existing ones. The big versions that are worth listing pre-emptively, like 1.2.0, 3.0.0 etc., are usually considered Milestones. "Versions" on the other hand can be build-sensitive, so you have stuff like 1.2.0-243b. You can't pre-empt versions like that.
fields.summary: Version as text input field with auto-completion instead of drop-down (BB-10775)

fields.description: Currently, if you leave comments on the commit page itself, there is no record of them in the pull request.  It would be great if you could leave comments on the commit _or_ pull request and have them show up on the pull request overview page as well.
fields.summary: Show commit comments on associated pull request overview (BB-10776)

fields.description:
We are getting random 502 errors when trying to load a static website.  Example url:\\
http://modernsignal.bitbucket.org/nahb/ibs2015/search-education.html

There is a relatively large number of linked assets, and reloading the page produces a 502 error for a random sampling of them.  The last commit was two days ago and it was working after that.
fields.summary: Random 502 error for static website (BB-10777)

fields.description:
Hi :D

Being able to specify certain branches as public in a private repository would be a feature that many users (including me) would appreciate very much. So far to achieve a similar effect a second, opublic repository would have to be created, making branch interactions like merge and rebase almost impossible or very complicated.

Regards\\
TBot
fields.summary: Public and private branches in one Repo (BB-10774)

fields.description:
Bitbucket's API lacks an equivalent to the GitHub META API. - https://developer.github.com/v3/meta/

Real world example. I have a webhook handler, it works fantastically for GitHub, I use the GitHub meta API to check if the source address of a GitHub webhook is valid. Adding Bitbucket support requires me to hard code whitelist IPs into my code, increasing the maintenance burden imposed by using bitbucket to host my code, and makes it more difficult for me to recommend bitbucket when working with other people.
fields.summary: Bitbucket "Meta" API (BB-10773)
Bitbucket

fields.description:
While viewing single commits (url: bitbucket.org/[user]/[repo]/commits/#######ect ), it would be helpful to have next and previous buttons to make it easier to step through individual commits.

I've attached a mock-up if anyone finds that helpful.
fields.summary: Add Next & Prev commit buttons to single commit view.

fields.summary: Dropdown buttons not working
File encoding in diff view (BB-10792)
SSH hanging up unexpectedly

fields.description:
When I use the "View Raw Commit" button on a commit detail page, it does not show the {{Commit}} or {{CommitDate}} fields.

This data is shown with a {{git show --format=fuller}}.
fields.summary: View raw commit does not show Commit or Commit Date (BB-10764)

fields.description:
We use a git rebase workflow.

That means that I often _accept_ a pull request from a co-worker, but don't use BitBucket's merge button to merge it in, and instead do a bit of rewriting, then push the commits.

Is there any good way to close the pull requests after I do this? The Decline button seems to be the only way, but I'm _not_ declining the pull request. In fact, the pull request got accepted, and I note which relevant commits got pushed into the repo.

Can I close a pull request as accepted without using the merge button?
fields.summary: Close a pull request without declining (BB-10765)

fields.description:
When I was using Bitbucket for the first time, it took me quite some time until I found the Settings button.

This is due to the fact that it is partially covered by Chromes status bar:

!http://i.imgur.com/5Vhq2bl.png!

In general, I would expect a button like that to be positioned near the top of the website, not the bottom.
fields.summary: Unfortunate placement of settings button (BB-10766)

fields.description: i have a "if condition" that i just forgot in which template or controller file my other co-worker just added, how i can search in the repository?
fields.summary: How to search in the source code of repository

fields.description:
As an owner I want to restrict branch deletion to certain group .

We want to restrict and prevent certain users from deleting branches, but still allow users to contribute code.
fields.summary: As an owner I want to restrict branch  deletion to certain group (BB-10762)

fields.description: When creating a table, I need to use the pipe | character as part of the content (not structure) of the table. I am not able to find a way to escape the character as a literal.
fields.summary: As a Developer, I would like a mechanism to escape the pipe | character in Wiki

fields.description:
While the README.md document fits a certain workflow it does not fit the one at my company. While the Overview page is generally the best choice as a landing page for staff, have a "Create README" sad face is more than completely useless.

Request that:

* It can be removed from overview page
* It can added as part of the configuration metadata in Bitbucket, not part of the repo

Not having a MD file in the repo root was one of the nice little differences from GitHub. It's sad Bitbucket felt compelled to copy this.
fields.summary: Take README off overview page or make part of config, not repo (BB-10759)

fields.description: Site is not accessible, went to the status page it says that all features are on major outage.
fields.summary: Site is not accessible

fields.description:
Hi, I created my new account trompetin17 and i gave the message

"Your account has been deactivated. Please contact Bitbucket Support for assistance."

What can i do?
fields.summary: Your account has been deactivated

fields.description:
In my repo (https://bitbucket.org/SRH/tower) the reported size is 1.7GB.

It actually was that large as someone comitted a lot of stuff he shouldn't have. I've removed that commits from the history a few days ago, but the repo still reports 1.7GB.\\
When I run "git count-objects -v -H" it reports size-pack: 151.58 MiB

So I'm guessing there is something wrong on the size reported by bitbucket.
fields.summary: Wrong repo size
b1u1s4t6 -- dialog order London eye
b1u1s2t3 -- dialog order stop the thief
b1u1s2t2-- dialog order big ben

fields.description:
https://www.dropbox.com/home/Road%20Trip%20Illustrations%20Share/Book%201/~Tasks/Speech%20Bubble%2C%20Dialog%20Order/Gap%20Fill%2C%20Order/Unit%201/b1u1s1t1

There are three round on this stage.
fields.summary: b1u1s1t1 -- Bus Dialog Order

fields.description:
For some reason, .exe files recently uploaded lose their extension when downloaded with IE (tested with IE9 and IE11).

On the download page they show up with the .exe extension.\\
When the download starts the .exe extension is omitted from the filename.
fields.summary: Executable files lose their extension when downloaded by IE (BB-10760)

fields.description: As of 6/8/2014, using the 1.0 API, retriving a list of issues for a repository no longer reports the comment count which it used to. Log file has been attached. I would assume that since API 2.0 is being work on the 1.0 API would stop changing. However, this is not the first time a breaking change has been introduced into 1.0 without there being a suitable replacement in 2.0. Why has this occured?
fields.summary: REST API: Issues no longer report Comment Count

fields.description:
Hi there,

I just created an account "danjiao23". But up on completion, I was told the account has been deactivated. Could you check it for me?

Thanks!
fields.summary: account deactivated

fields.description: Currently it is using JSP. Shall use JS directly
fields.summary: Use JS for localization

fields.description:
Scenario:\\
Repo: sandbox-site.git\\
Custom domain: git.mywebsite.com

When accessing the wiki via git.mywebsite.com/sandbox-site/wiki/, if you click on a link in any table of contents generated by

{code}
<<toc / 2>>


{code}

the links you're provided with become: git.mywebsite.com/*my_account_name*/sandbox-site/wiki, which produces a dead-link page.
fields.summary: Links invalid when using customer domain (BB-10755)

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a zombie branch in one of my projects. It was deleted by a merge request, but is still shown in https://bitbucket.org/<team>/<project>/branches.

I get a 404 error whenever I click on it though.

I have tried refreshing the page in my browser several times, to no avail.

Thanks
fields.summary: Zombie branch, cannot be deleted

fields.description:
Hi everyone,\\
The current branch changes when I want to look for a specific file on a other branch

Process :

* Go to 'source'
* Change the branch to a different one
* Press 'F' to search a file and type the name of one file
* Press 'Enter' to go to the file
* The page reloads and the branch is changed to the master one
fields.summary: Branch changing after research (BB-10754)
Unable to sign up!

fields.description: Edits/adds/deletes made locally to the wiki do not show up in the newsfeed in repository overview after being pushed up to Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Local wiki edits don't show up in newsfeed (BB-10752)

fields.description:
Hello BitBucket,

We have a few repositories that apparently went over the size limit.  I don't know if this is new policy, but seems like it's impacting us.  Anyway to get temporary relief until we can get them cleaned up?

We usually ignore media files, but a few of them got in there it seems and no clue how to remove them.

Thanks,

Eddie
fields.summary: Repository Size

fields.description:
Hey,\\
in the commits list the branch and tag labels are not centeres. It's not that important, but it looks strange.

Thanks and greetings\\
Leo
fields.summary: Tag and branch labels are not centered (BB-10757)

fields.description:
According to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Version+2#Version2-Pagingthroughobjectcollections the global pagelen maximum is set a 100, but some API resources seem to be limited to 50 per page.

For example, https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/jespern/django-piston/pullrequests?pagelen=50 Works, but when you set the pagelen to anything higher then 50 and you get an error.

This is either a bug in the documentation or this resource should be changed to accept a pagelen of 100.
fields.summary: Pagelen wrongfully limited 50 for API 2.0 (BB-10761)

fields.description: Branch names are listed on the commit view before that commit has been merged back to the main branch, but no branch names are listed afterwards.
fields.summary: Commit View doesn't show any branch names after it's been merged to the main branch (BB-10767)

fields.description:
Last two days when i try to open bitbucket cards in browser it show me "application error", I also try to change browser still it show me the same.

can any body help me in this case ? Is this issue on bitbucket card or problem under my bibucket account
fields.summary: bitbucket cards show me "application error"

fields.description: I've got a private repository to which I 'git clone' a repo. I then pushed it with the .git folder still inside. After I realized this I removed the .git folder the cached file moved the folder checked for submodules and did a push yet the files are still there.
fields.summary: Will not remove submodules after folder is moved/deleted

fields.description:
It would be great to add a default interface language setting at repository for anonymous users.

Members of my site are not programmers and do not have an account here.\\
So when they want to add the issue they see English version.\\
Confusing language in an unfamiliar interface scares them. They close the tracker.

Sorry for google translate.
